result.execSummary:
The defendant Melanie R. Hansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DNA sample to be provided.  Restitution of $592.00 paid in full by money order to DA in Court.  Apology letter to victim also provided to DA in Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Melanie R. Hansen in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recommendations.  Atty Varner in agreement and NC plea entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS. DE makes statement on her own behalf.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  NC
